intro: Stenogyne multiflora, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Stenogyne multiflora plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
